intro: Hedyotis kanehirae, commonly known as the Japanese pennywort, is a flowering plant native to Japan and Korea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Hedyotis kanehirae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
